data.title: Frank Zappa News
data.meta_description: Frank Zappa was one of rock’s true oddballs, innovators and all-around contradictory guys. He made freak-out music but didn’t take drugs. He turned out tons of music every year but had little interest in being a star. And he dev...
data.text:
Frank Zappa's 'Apostrophe' Celebrates 50th Anniversary With Box

His only Top 10 LP will be expanded to six discs, including live tracks and bonus songs from the sessions.

Tom Fowler, Frank Zappa and Ray Charles Bassist, Dead at 73

He also played with George Duke, Jean-Luc Ponty, Steve Hackett and others.

Ed Mann, Frank Zappa's Longtime Percussionist, Dead at 70

He played on over 30 of the prolific rocker's albums.

Steve Vai Recalls Feeling Sick and Scared After Frank Zappa Tour

Guitarist nearly came off the road for good after grueling lifestyle but David Lee Roth experience changed his mind.

Frank Zappa and the Mothers' 'Whisky a Go Go, 1968' Announced

Three-disc set includes nearly five hours of unreleased material.

The Unfunny Night Frank Zappa Got Himself Banned From 'SNL'

Flat delivery and breaking character ensured his first guest host spot was also his last.

Frank Zappa, 'Funky Nothingness': Album Review

Previously unreleased recordings from proposed 'Hot Rats' follow-up includes unissued LP plus two additional discs of 1970 sessions.

Unearthed Frank Zappa Album 'Funky Nothingness' Set for Release

Recorded in 1970, the songs are believed to have been for a follow-up to solo debut 'Hot Rats.'

Ian Anderson's Big Regret Over Frank Zappa

Jethro Tull leader was too embarrassed to speak to dying artist: "Each time I hung up in panic."
